title: Croup Symptoms
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: What Are the Symptoms of Croup?
content: Croup usually starts as a cold . Your child might have a runny or stuffy nose and a fever . But it doesn’t take long before your little one’s symptoms turn into something else.
A virus usually causes croup. Your child may get it by breathing infected droplets or touching a germy surface and then their eyes, nose, or mouth. Here are the signs your child may have croup:
Croup symptoms may be worse at night and usually last 3 to 5 days.
bullets: A cough that sounds like a bark
Hoarse or raspy voice
Noisy, labored breathing (stridor)
Fever (in some cases)
Rash
Eye redness
Swollen lymph nodes

sections.heading: Serious Croup Symptoms
content: Call your doctor if symptoms don’t improve after 3 to 5 days or if they get worse. See your doctor right away if your child:
bullets: Makes a noisy, high-pitched breathing sound (doctors call it stridor) when they breathe in or out
Starts drooling or has a hard time swallowing
Is anxious or agitated, or has no energy
Breathes much faster than usual
Has a hard time breathing (chest muscles pull in)
Turns gray or blue around their nose, mouth , or fingernails
Drinks less with minimal to no urine output
Seems to be dehydrated, with dry lips or tongue
